duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide general nursing care to patients including administering prescribed medications and treatments in accordance with nursing standards and per orders.
Organize and provide clinical supervision to the patient care team including delegation of responsibilities, mentoring, evaluating, educating, scheduling, and counseling the care team staff.
Review patient charts for missing labs, reports, and/or open orders and review as part of care team huddles.
Assist with new hire orientation, staff training, providing feedback for performance evaluations, and providing information related to employee discipline and termination of staff.
Prepare and manage materials and deliverables. Review patient charts for missing labs, reports, and/or open orders and review as part of the care team huddles.
Coordinate and manage daily huddles. Prepare and manage materials and deliverables. Review patient charts for missing labs, reports, and/or open orders and review as part of care team huddles.
Facilitate clinical messages and chronic condition management education to patients. Document progress notes in electronic health record within 24 hours.
Serve as a clinical liaison between the call center and medical office. Triage urgent same day or double-booked appointment requests.
Coordinate outpatient work-up and or treatment plans when required, and facilitate communication between physicians and health care providers.
Prepare prescriptions or medication refills for review and signature by the provider.
Perform other job-related duties including participation in nursing practice work groups and committees.

education_certification.credential: Graduate of an accredited school of nursing. Bachelor’s Degree in Nursing. Current unencumbered New York State Registered Nurse license. BLS certification.
